str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The Sabbath, a week.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
To break (in pieces), break bread. A primary verb; to break.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
(originally: I shall go out), I go out (away), depart. From ek and eimi; to issue, i.e. Leave, escape.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To converse, address, preach, lecture; I argue, reason. Middle voice from dia and lego; to say thoroughly, i.e. Discuss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To extend, prolong, continue. From para and teino; to extend along, i.e. Prolong.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
As far as, until, even to.
Midnight, the middle of the period between sunset and sunrise. Neuter of compound of mesos and nux; midnight.
